00016     FactoredApproximator::FactoredApproximator(Approximators approximators, bool splitObs) {
00017 
00018         this->approximators = approximators;
00019         this->splitObs = splitObs;
00020         dummyDist.resize(1);
00021 
00022     }

00024 
00028     void FactoredApproximator::doApprox(Observation& obs, Vector& output) {
00029     
00030         // Can only have one winning action here!
00031         assert(output.size() == approximators.size());
00032 
00033         if (splitObs) {
00034             // If we have a col for each approximator, they get their own
00035             // observation.
00036             assert(obs.getFeatures().size2() == approximators.size());
00037         } else {
00038             assert(obs.getFeatures().size2() == 1);
00039         }
00040     
00041         bool oneEligible = false;
00042 
00043         //cout<<"<<<<<<<<<Approximators.size="<<approximators.size()<<endl;
00044         // Loop over possible actions, each is its own approximator
00045 
00046         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < approximators.size(); i++) {
00047             if (!obs.getEligible()(i)) { // This action not eligible.
00048                 
00049                 // [daa] output[i] = 0.; This is wrong because the number will be exponentiated
00050                 // to make a probability distribution. Doesn't make any difference if the
00051                 // sampler knows about eligible actions, but better not to assume it does.
00052 
00053                 output[i] = numeric_limits<double>::min();
00054             } else {
00055                 if (splitObs) obs.setAgent(i);
00056                 approximators[i]->doApprox(obs, dummyDist);
00057                 output[i] = dummyDist[0];
00058                 if (isnan(dummyDist[0])) {
00059                     cout<<"approx "<<i<<" output is nan, weights ";
00060                     approximators[i]->write(cout);
00061                     cout<<endl;
00062                 }
00063                 oneEligible = true;
00064             }
00065         }
00066 
00067         if (!oneEligible) throw std::runtime_error("No actions eligible in FactoredApproximator\n");
00068     }
00069

00071     void FactoredApproximator::feedbackGrad(Observation& obs, Vector& deltas) {
00072 
00073      
00074         assert(deltas.size() == approximators.size());
00075 
00076         for (uint i=0; i <  approximators.size(); i++) {
00077             if (!obs.getEligible()(i)) continue;
00078             assert(approximators[i]->getOutputDim() == 1);
00079             dummyDist[0] = deltas[i];
00080             approximators[i]->feedbackGrad(obs, dummyDist);
00081         }
00082         
00083     }

00099             (*i)->discountTrace();

00113     void FactoredApproximator::accumulateGrad(double reward, Observation& newObs) {
00114 
00115         for (uint i = 0; i < approximators.size(); i++) {
00116             if (reward != 0.0) approximators[i]->accumulateGrad(reward, newObs);        
00117         }
00118     }

00186     double FactoredApproximator::getMaxParam() {
00187         double maxi = 0.0;
00188         Approximators::iterator i;
00189         for (i = approximators.begin(); i != approximators.end(); i++) {
00190             maxi = std::max(maxi, (*i)->getMaxParam());
00191         }
00192         return maxi;
00193     }

00196     int FactoredApproximator::getNumParams() {
00197         int p = 0;
00198         Approximators::iterator i;
00199         for (i = approximators.begin(); i != approximators.end(); i++) {
00200             p += (*i)->getNumParams();
00201         }
00202         return p;
00203     }

00221     int FactoredApproximator::getInputDim() { return approximators[0]->getInputDim(); }
00222     int FactoredApproximator::getOutputDim() { return approximators.size(); }

00227     void FactoredApproximator::scatter(Vector& v, Approximator::StatsEnum s) {
00228 
00229         int p;
00230         Approximators::iterator i;
00231 
00232         switch (s) {
00233         case Approximator::PARAMS:
00234         case Approximator::GRADS:
00235         case Approximator::TRACES:
00236             p = 0;
00237             for (i = approximators.begin(); i != approximators.end(); i++) {
00238                 int nParams = (*i)->getNumParams();
00239                 Vector w(nParams);
00240                 //w.clear();
00241                 w = project(v, range(p ,p+nParams));
00242                 (*i)->scatter(w, s);
00243                 p += nParams;
00244             }
00245             break;
00246         default:
00247             throw runtime_error("unknown StatsEnum FactoredApproximator::scatter\n");
00248         }
00249 
00250     }
00251 
00252 
00253     void FactoredApproximator::reduce(Vector& v, Approximator::StatsEnum s) {
00254 
00255         int p;
00256         Approximators::iterator i;
00257 
00258         switch (s) {
00259 
00260 
00261         case Approximator::PARAMS:
00262         case Approximator::GRADS:
00263         case Approximator::TRACES:
00264             p = 0;
00265             for (i = approximators.begin(); i != approximators.end(); i++) {
00266                 int nParams = (*i)->getNumParams();
00267                 Vector w(nParams);
00268                 //w.clear();
00269                 (*i)->reduce(w, s);
00270                 project(v, range(p, p+nParams)) = w;
00271                 p += nParams;
00272             }
00273 
00274             break;
00275         
00276         default:
00277             throw runtime_error("unknown StatsEnum FactoredApproximator::reduce\n");
00278         }
00279 
00280     }
